comment: Lectures were a bit bland and less than half the class ever showed. Take this course online as it is basic programming and easy to get the hang of with any prior coding experience. As a prof, Nie was okay, minmial interaction and very monotone lectures.

If I could rate this professor lower I would. The lecture videos are very unhelpful and some of the videos are unlisted. The worst part was the final, despite the date on the syllabus and me and several students taking it, she reposted the final the day after and then claimed it was never taken. I have escalated it to advisors, pending action

I saw this rating while registering for classes, and thought it would be fun to take the class anyway to see if the professor was actually a potato. I would, based on my extensive analysis and ultimate wisdom, conclude that the average rating displayed on this site accurately represents this professor. Earned A+ grade by being special. Have fun! ;)

I took this professor for matlab and honestly just horrible experience. She wouldn't explain much things and she just wrote the code with no explanation. when it came time to do the quiz and tests it wouldn't make any sense. If you have questions for her she wouldn't explain anything. not a good professor at all.

About half of our class contacted the department head about her at the beginning of the semester. She would change our quiz grades and mark off for things we got right and refuse to change the grades back when we showed her proof that we were right. Everything was eventually resolved when the dean got involved, but it was still a tiring experience.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Nie suffers from a lack of understanding. She struggles in speaking English and often incorrectly speaks. You could ask a question and not get a direct or concrete answer. It doesn't help when it sounds like she's unsure about the topic at hand herself, as she often pauses mid-lecture. She swears by the textbook and reads off of it.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Just drop the class and get someone else. She struggles very bad with english and if you got questions during class its almost impossible to get a legit answer.Makes attendance mandatory and literally just goes over power points.This is a very difficult class so you really need a good professor to go in depth with the material.

Prof Nie has to use the school's textbook for this class. It is not the best however, it was a very easy class. She reads off a PowerPoint and gives you assignments every week so you get practice. This class was easy but I didn't feel like I learned that much. The online homework is hard to access.

Professor was unprofessional and hard to work with. Wouldn't help students make up missed work even when providing a proper reason. And would cut students off if she felt like they were a nuisance. Randomly calls students out randomly and overall just too rude and inflexible to be a professor. Or teaching in any form of education for that matter.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: Most of the people leaving reviews prob never came to class or watched the class recordings. It's really easy as long as you follow along, all the test and quiz questions are examples from class w dif #. She's super nice and you can negotiate your grade as long as you explain why ur right. 5 points of EC are given to TOTAL GRADE, ppl just hattin fr
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: words cant describe how bad she is

She pulls up the textbook every class and read word for word to the students. She struggles with reading and writing english. She doesn't do examples with us. She only put on videos of examples. I can probably learn alone better. It sucks to pay professors for them to confuse me.

She did not have any idea how to set up the class for online teaching. We kept getting conflicting due dates and if we had a question she completely ignored us. Told us at the last minute we had a final. She didnt follow the syllabus at all. If you want a teacher who is confusing and unclear then this is the teacher for you.

She is literally one of the worst professors I've ever taken. Regularly doesn't seem to know what's going on. And the grading criteria are extremely unclear. Come to class prepared and with questions? Get ready to be completely ignored. Have questions about an assignment? Get ready to be told literally nothing about it in as many words as possible
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Great online professor. Everything is clear, just read the chapters and this course is a breeze.
A pretty easy teacher overall. I would recommend taking it online, but know that you will have to use your textbook which is pretty expensive.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Get ready to read

comment: acts like she is teaching a 3000 level class an expects you as if you have prior knowledge of Matlab. Struggles with English talking and writing, our group project was shambles because she didn't give us exactly what she wanted until 11 pm the night before it was due. ended up going to department head. Matlab is relatively easy, just not with her.

To the student reading this please do yourself a favor and DON'T take this professor MATLAB. This teacher is super unenthusiastic and not to mention she acts like it's her first time reading the material. English grammar is not her Strong suit so expect reading on your own. In summary get ready to teach yourself the whole class because she CAN'T.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: I kinda feel sorry for her, she seems to be very forgetful. She thinks her class is an upper level class and grades and teaches correspondingly. I would avoid her class!
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Group projects--Lecture heavy

comment: I took her for MATLAB and she has to be one of the worst professors I've had. She has a heavy accent which is difficult to understand. Her lectures are long and boring and very hard to pay attention to. I would avoid her at all cost!!
